metadata.text: The study concludes that intestinal microbiota play a significant role in regulating plasma cholesterol levels, hepatic cholesterol synthesis, and enterohepatic circulation. The findings suggest that targeting the gut microbiota could be a novel therapeutic approach for managing dyslipidemia and cardiovascular diseases.

metadata.text: The articles and research papers discussed various topics related to mycology, including the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, updates on international conferences, insights from books on fungi, and practical guides for dealing with food and indoor fungi. metadata.text: The prevalence of Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) in patients with morbid obesity varied between different obesity centers, with high LDL levels, self-reported psychiatric disorders, and thyroid dysfunction identified as predictors of IBS. Attention to dietary habits and thyroid function could be crucial in managing IBS in patients with morbid obesity.
